cocktails.name: Negroni
cocktails.description: The Negroni is the ideal freezer batch cocktail. Start with a 750ml bottle of gin, pour off 16oz to make room, then add equal parts Campari and sweet vermouth. No water needed - the freezer temperature smooths the alcohol beautifully.
tips: Use navy-strength gin (57% ABV) for extra insurance against freezing
Fresh sweet vermouth is critical - if open more than 4 weeks, don't use it
The bitterness softens beautifully after 48+ hours in the freezer
Express a fresh orange peel over the glass when serving
cocktails.serve: Pour into a rocks glass. Express orange peel over drink and drop in.
commonMistakes: Using old, oxidized vermouth
Forgetting to stir/shake bottle before pouring

seo.title: Freezer Batch Negroni Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Calculate the perfect freezer batch Negroni. Pre-batch this classic Italian aperitivo for ready-to-pour cocktails straight from your freezer.

cocktails.name: Manhattan
cocktails.description: The Manhattan is an outstanding freezer batch candidate. Using the Milk Street method, pour off just 4.5oz from a bottle of rye, add vermouth and cherry syrup. The cold temperature tames the rye's spice beautifully.
tips: Ensure the vermouth is fresh - open less than 4-6 weeks
Rye whiskey is traditional, but bourbon works beautifully too
The bitters bloom over time - don't overdo it
Serve in a chilled Nick & Nora or coupe glass
cocktails.serve: Pour into a chilled coupe or Nick & Nora glass. Garnish with a brandied cherry.
commonMistakes: Using oxidized vermouth
Over-pouring bitters

seo.title: Freezer Batch Manhattan Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Make the perfect freezer batch Manhattan. Batch this classic whiskey cocktail for ready-to-pour sophistication.

cocktails.name: Old Fashioned
cocktails.description: The Old Fashioned is the simplest freezer batch - almost pure bourbon. Pour off just 1.33oz from a 750ml bottle, add agave syrup and bitters. The bourbon's vanilla notes become silky smooth at freezer temperatures.
tips: Use rich simple syrup (2:1 sugar to water) - it dissolves completely
Never muddle sugar for a batch - it won't dissolve properly
A pinch of salt in the batch enhances the bourbon's sweetness
Express fresh orange peel over each pour
cocktails.serve: Pour over a large ice cube in a rocks glass. Express orange peel and drop in.
commonMistakes: Using granulated sugar instead of syrup
Too much bitters - they intensify when cold

seo.title: Freezer Batch Old Fashioned Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Batch the perfect Old Fashioned for your freezer. Ready-to-pour whiskey cocktails whenever you want them.

cocktails.name: Boulevardier
cocktails.tagline: A whiskey Negroni that improves with time
cocktails.description: The Boulevardier is essentially a bourbon Negroni, and it batches identically well. The bourbon's vanilla notes marry with the Campari over time - this one actually improves after a week in the freezer.
tips: This improves dramatically after 1+ week in the freezer
The bourbon-Campari marriage is better than gin-Campari for long storage
Use a higher-proof bourbon (100 proof) for extra ABV insurance
cocktails.serve: Pour into a rocks glass. Orange peel expressed and dropped in.
commonMistakes: Drinking it too soon - patience rewards

seo.title: Freezer Batch Boulevardier Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Make a batch Boulevardier for your freezer. This bourbon Negroni variant actually improves with freezer time.

cocktails.name: Dirty Martini
cocktails.description: The Dirty Martini is an excellent and often overlooked freezer batch candidate. The olive brine is shelf-stable, and the high vodka ABV keeps everything beautifully liquid. Use quality olive brine for best results.
tips: Use quality olive brine - Filthy Food brand is excellent
Avoid supermarket olive jar brine - it's too acidic
Gin works equally well if you prefer botanical notes
Store olives separately and add to glass when serving
cocktails.serve: Pour into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with 2-3 olives on a pick.
commonMistakes: Using cheap olive brine
Adding olives to the batch (they'll get bloated)

seo.title: Freezer Batch Dirty Martini Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Batch the perfect Dirty Martini for your freezer. Briny, cold, and ready whenever you are.

cocktails.name: Margarita
cocktails.description: The Margarita batches beautifully using the Milk Street method. Start with a 750ml bottle of tequila, pour off 10oz to make room, then add fresh lime, orange liqueur, and agave. No water needed - the citrus provides the liquid balance.
tips: Shake the bottle well before each pour to recombine
Add a pinch of salt to the bottle - it enhances the tequila
Use 100% agave tequila for best results
Fresh lime juice stays delicious for weeks in the freezer
No water needed - lime juice provides the liquid balance
cocktails.serve: Pour over ice, salt rim optional. Garnish with lime wheel.
commonMistakes: Using bottled lime juice
Adding too much water (the citrus already dilutes)

cocktails.name: Cosmopolitan
cocktails.description: The Cosmopolitan batches beautifully. The cranberry and lime hold up great in the freezer - just shake the bottle before pouring. The pink color stays vibrant for weeks.
tips: Use 100% cranberry juice, not cranberry cocktail
Shake the bottle well before pouring to recombine
A flamed orange peel at service adds drama
The pink color stays vibrant for weeks
cocktails.serve: Pour into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with flamed orange peel.
commonMistakes: Using cranberry cocktail instead of 100% juice

seo.title: Freezer Batch Cosmopolitan Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Batch the perfect Cosmopolitan for your freezer. Pink, sophisticated, and ready to pour.

cocktails.name: Moscow Mule
cocktails.description: The Moscow Mule requires a partial-batch approach. Batch the vodka, lime, and ginger syrup, then add fresh ginger beer when serving. Never batch the ginger beer - you'll lose all carbonation.

recipe.serveWith: Top with 60ml ginger beer when serving

tips: Never add ginger beer to the batch - it goes flat
Use ginger syrup to get ginger flavor in the batch
Top with fresh ginger beer when serving
Copper mugs aren't necessary but look great
cocktails.serve: Pour 2oz batch over ice in a copper mug. Top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wheel.
commonMistakes: Batching the ginger beer (it goes flat)
Forgetting the ginger syrup base

seo.title: Freezer Batch Moscow Mule Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Make a freezer-ready Moscow Mule base. Add ginger beer fresh for perfect fizz every time.

cocktails.name: Espresso Martini
cocktails.tagline: Coffee meets cocktail, chilled and ready
cocktails.description: The Espresso Martini batches perfectly using cold brew concentrate instead of fresh espresso. The cold environment preserves the coffee flavor beautifully, and a hard shake before serving creates the signature foam.
tips: Use cold brew concentrate, not fresh espresso (it stays stable)
Hard shake the bottle before pouring - you want some aeration
You won't get the fresh espresso crema, but the flavor is great
A few coffee beans as garnish adds visual appeal
cocktails.serve: Hard shake bottle. Pour into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with 3 coffee beans.
commonMistakes: Using fresh espresso (goes stale in hours)
Expecting the same crema as fresh-made

seo.title: Freezer Batch Espresso Martini Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Batch an Espresso Martini for your freezer. Tips for coffee cocktails that stay fresh.

cocktails.name: Paper Plane
cocktails.description: The Paper Plane is a modern classic that batches beautifully. Equal parts bourbon, Aperol, Amaro Nonino, and lemon create perfect balance. Fresh lemon juice stays delicious for weeks in the freezer - just shake before serving.
tips: This lands in the slushy zone - that's okay, it's still delicious
For firmer texture, increase bourbon ratio slightly
Equal parts makes it easy to remember and scale
Shake well before pouring to recombine ingredients
cocktails.serve: Pour into a coupe glass. No garnish needed.
commonMistakes: Expecting it to be fully liquid (it'll be slightly slushy)
Using a different amaro (Nonino is specific to this drink)

seo.title: Freezer Batch Paper Plane Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Batch the modern classic Paper Plane for your freezer. Perfect bitter-sweet balance, ready to pour.

cocktails.name: Daiquiri
cocktails.description: The classic Daiquiri batches beautifully using the Milk Street method. Pour off 7oz from a bottle of white rum, add fresh lime, a touch of water, and agave syrup. The freezer mellows the rum while keeping the citrus bright.
tips: Use fresh lime juice only - bottled won't cut it
Shake the bottle well before each pour
Fresh lime stays bright for 2-3 weeks in the freezer
A dash of Peychaud's bitters adds complexity
cocktails.serve: Pour into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
commonMistakes: Using bottled lime juice
Skipping the small amount of water dilution

seo.title: Freezer Batch Daiquiri Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Calculate your perfect freezer Daiquiri batch. The classic rum sour, ready whenever you are.

cocktails.name: Vesper
cocktails.description: The Vesper is James Bond's signature cocktail and an excellent freezer batch candidate. Using the Milk Street method, pour off 10oz from a gin bottle, add vodka and Cocchi Americano. The high ABV keeps it perfectly pourable.
tips: Cocchi Americano is the proper substitute for discontinued Kina Lillet
No water needed - this is meant to be spirit-forward
Express a lemon peel over the glass when serving
Use a quality London Dry gin
cocktails.serve: Pour into a chilled martini glass. Express lemon peel over drink.
commonMistakes: Using Lillet Blanc (it's sweeter than original Kina Lillet)
Adding water or over-diluting

seo.title: Freezer Batch Vesper Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Make James Bond's signature cocktail in a freezer batch. The Vesper, perfectly chilled and always ready.

cocktails.name: Mint Julep
cocktails.description: The Mint Julep adapts beautifully to freezer batching by using a homemade mint syrup. Pour off just 3.25oz from your bourbon bottle and add the mint syrup. The result is a smooth, minty bourbon that's ready for Derby Day or any day.

batch.extras: Mint syrup: Blend 2 cups fresh mint + 0.5 cup sugar + 0.5 cup water, then strain

tips: Make mint syrup by blending fresh mint with simple syrup, then straining
Use a high-proof bourbon (100 proof) for best results
Serve over crushed ice for the traditional experience
Garnish with a generous bouquet of fresh mint
cocktails.serve: Pour over crushed ice in a julep cup or rocks glass. Garnish with fresh mint sprig.
commonMistakes: Using mint extract instead of fresh mint syrup
Skipping the crushed ice when serving

seo.title: Freezer Batch Mint Julep Recipe & Calculator
seo.description: Make a freezer-ready Mint Julep batch. Kentucky's classic, perfectly chilled and always ready.

reliabilityTiers.bulletproof: These cocktails batch perfectly and stay delicious for weeks in the freezer. Just shake well before serving.
reliabilityTiers.needs-attention: These work great but require specific handling - usually adding carbonation when serving.
